item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "Perhaps it is better to wake up after all, even to suffer, rather than to remain a dupe to illusions all one's life." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Maggie add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?" -- Rumi

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Maggie add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Bei Dao
item.description: "In the world I am Always a stranger I do not understand its language It does not understand my silence" -- Bei Dao
